Transcription for 1268586

We love the song that they would never end,
When things go wrong, A man is proud and grand, Without a song.
That field of gold would never steer now, That field of gold would be at bedroom now,
A man is born, And he's no good no how, Without a song.
I've got much trouble I know, But sure as I know there's other than one.
I'll be alone as long as the song is sung in my town, I'll never know what makes that great song,
I'll never know what makes that grass so tall, I only know there is no love at all, Without a song.
I only know there is no love at all, Without a song.
